SCP 0.2.1.9001
  • Reference

Standard_SCP

Source: R/SCP-workflow.R
Standard_SCP.Rd

Single cell pipeline for the single dataset.

Usage

Standard_SCP(
  srt,
  prefix = "Standard",
  do_normalization = NULL,
  normalization_method = "logCPM",
  do_HVF_finding = TRUE,
  HVF_method = "vst",
  nHVF = 2000,
  HVF = NULL,
  do_scaling = TRUE,
  vars_to_regress = NULL,
  regression_model = "linear",
  linear_reduction = "pca",
  linear_reduction_dims = 100,
  linear_reduction_dims_use = NULL,
  linear_reduction_params = list(),
  force_linear_reduction = FALSE,
  nonlinear_reduction = "umap",
  nonlinear_reduction_dims = c(2, 3),
  nonlinear_reduction_params = list(),
  force_nonlinear_reduction = TRUE,
  do_cluster_finding = TRUE,
  cluster_algorithm = "louvain",
  cluster_resolution = 0.6,
  cluster_reorder = TRUE,
  seed = 11
)

Arguments

srt

A Seurat object.

prefix

The prefix used to name the result.

do_normalization

Whether to normalize the data. If NULL, will automatically determine.

normalization_method

Normalization method.Can be one of "logCPM", "SCT".

do_HVF_finding

Whether to find the high variable features(HVF). If NULL, will automatically determine.

nHVF

HVF number to use.

HVF

Custom high variable features.

do_scaling

Whether to scale the data. If NULL, will automatically determine.

vars_to_regress

Variables to regress out.

regression_model

Use a linear model or generalized linear model (poisson, negative binomial) for the regression. Options are "linear" (default), "poisson", and "negbinom".

linear_reduction

linear reduction method name. Can be one of "pca", "ica", "nmf", "mds", "glmpca".

linear_reduction_dims

Dimensions to calculate when performing linear reduction.

linear_reduction_dims_use

Which dimensions to use when performing the nonlinear reduction.

nonlinear_reduction

Non-linear reduction method name. Can be one of "umap", "umap-naive", "tsne", "dm", "phate", "pacmap", "trimap", "largevis".

nonlinear_reduction_dims

Dimensions to calculate when performing non-linear reduction.

force_nonlinear_reduction
cluster_algorithm

Algorithm for modularity optimization when finding clusters. Can be one of "louvain", "slm", "leiden".

cluster_resolution

Cluster resolution parameter.

cluster_reorder

Whether to reorder the cluster names using hierarchical clustering.

seed

Set a random seed.

Value

A Seurat object containing the result.

Examples

data("pancreas_sub")
pancreas_sub <- Standard_SCP(srt = pancreas_sub)
#> [2022-11-01 21:13:48] Start Standard_SCP
#> [2022-11-01 21:13:48] Checking srtList... ...
#> Data 1/1 of the srtList is raw counts. Perform NormalizeData(logCPM) on the data ...
#> Perform FindVariableFeatures on the data 1/1 of the srtList...
#> Use the separate HVF from the existed HVF in srtList...
#> [2022-11-01 21:13:51] Finished checking.
#> [2022-11-01 21:13:51] Perform ScaleData on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:13:53] Perform linear dimension reduction (pca) on the data...
#> dims_estimate is 1:18 for 'pca'
#> [2022-11-01 21:14:02] Perform FindClusters (louvain) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:14:03] Reorder clusters...
#> [2022-11-01 21:14:03] Perform nonlinear dimension reduction (umap) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:14:16] Standard_SCP done
#> Elapsed time: 27.78 secs 
ClassDimPlot(pancreas_sub, group.by = "CellType")


# Use a combination of different linear or non-linear dimension reduction methods
pancreas_sub <- Standard_SCP(
  srt = pancreas_sub,
  linear_reduction = c("pca", "ica", "nmf", "mds", "glmpca"),
  nonlinear_reduction = c("umap", "tsne", "phate", "pacmap", "trimap")
)
#> [2022-11-01 21:14:17] Start Standard_SCP
#> [2022-11-01 21:14:17] Checking srtList... ...
#> Data 1/1 of the srtList has been log-normalized.
#> Perform FindVariableFeatures on the data 1/1 of the srtList...
#> Use the separate HVF from the existed HVF in srtList...
#> [2022-11-01 21:14:19] Finished checking.

#> dims_estimate is 1:18 for 'pca'
#> [2022-11-01 21:14:28] Perform FindClusters (louvain) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:14:28] Reorder clusters...
#> [2022-11-01 21:14:28] Perform nonlinear dimension reduction (umap) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:14:41] Perform nonlinear dimension reduction (tsne) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:14:59] Perform nonlinear dimension reduction (phate) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:15:38] Perform nonlinear dimension reduction (pacmap) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:15:49] Perform nonlinear dimension reduction (trimap) on the data...

#> dims_estimate is 1:29 for 'ica'

#> [2022-11-01 21:16:14] Perform nonlinear dimension reduction (umap) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:16:27] Perform nonlinear dimension reduction (tsne) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:16:52] Perform nonlinear dimension reduction (phate) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:17:33] Perform nonlinear dimension reduction (pacmap) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:17:44] Perform nonlinear dimension reduction (trimap) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:17:56] Perform linear dimension reduction (nmf) on the data...
#> dims_estimate is 1:100 for 'nmf'
#> [2022-11-01 21:18:53] Perform FindClusters (louvain) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:18:53] Reorder clusters...
#> [2022-11-01 21:18:54] Perform nonlinear dimension reduction (umap) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:19:08] Perform nonlinear dimension reduction (tsne) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:19:29] Perform nonlinear dimension reduction (phate) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:20:05] Perform nonlinear dimension reduction (pacmap) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:20:16] Perform nonlinear dimension reduction (trimap) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:20:28] Perform linear dimension reduction (mds) on the data...
#> Use RNA/data to measure 'euclidean' distance.
#> dims_estimate is 1:18 for 'mds'
#> [2022-11-01 21:21:05] Perform FindClusters (louvain) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:21:06] Reorder clusters...
#> [2022-11-01 21:21:07] Perform nonlinear dimension reduction (umap) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:21:20] Perform nonlinear dimension reduction (tsne) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:21:42] Perform nonlinear dimension reduction (phate) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:22:25] Perform nonlinear dimension reduction (pacmap) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:22:36] Perform nonlinear dimension reduction (trimap) on the data...
#> [2022-11-01 21:22:48] Perform linear dimension reduction (glmpca) on the data...
#> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘glmpca’
names(pancreas_sub@reductions)
#> [1] "PCA"               "UMAP"              "Standardpca"       "StandardpcaUMAP2D" "StandardpcaUMAP3D"
#> [6] "StandardUMAP2D"    "StandardUMAP3D"
